author: pi118
content: Why doesn't the Rospen website open? Do you have a website?

author: ryanleeschneider
content: IIRC someone mentioned a tool they were using to sniff the localhost engine API traffic?  `tcpflow` has an annoying bug where it only parses gzip when writing to files, not to stdout, I vaguely recall someone mentioned some other tool they were using but tried searching here and couldn't find it.

author: parithosh
content:
you can use this: https://github.com/ethDreamer/json_rpc_snoop (its what we use for merge testing)

```
docker run --name=snooper --network=host parithoshj/json_rpc_snoop:v1.0.0-x86 ./json_rpc_snoop -p 8560 http://127.0.0.1:8551
```
will listen on port 8560 and dump req/response to logs before forwarding it to 8551

author: ryanleeschneider
content: thanks that's what I was looking for, I remembered the word "snoop" was in it but Discord search doesn't hit it.

author: ryanleeschneider
content:
FWIW I ended up writing a function to send the tcpdump output through to decode the gzip "inline", something along the lines of `tcpdump -i lo -w - tcp port 8551 | go run main.go`

https://go.dev/play/p/PGRaR7MElX9
